Body:
BC-LADN-BUDGET 
   The Los Angeles Daily News plans to move the following general
stories for use by NYTimes News Service clients, AMs and PMs of
Saturday, Jan. 2 and thereafter. For questions about stories,
contact Jeremy Bagott at the Daily News, (818) 713-3702.

   HANDY-MAN (Los Angeles) _ How to hire a handyman to fix all
those things on your ``to do'' list. Part of a series.

   By Greg Wilcox. (Will move in the ``f'' financial news file.)

   ROSE-PARADE (Los Angeles) _ With a roar of modern jets and a
burst of old-fashioned drums, the last Tournament of Roses parade
of the 1900s rumbled Friday through a cool, hazy dawn. Glitches
were few _ two floats broke down and had to be towed along the
7-mile route _ and the crowd was serene. By David Baker. (Will move
in the ``a'' national and ``n'' California news file.)

   BURNED-BOY (Los Angeles) _ Doctors at Grossman Burn Center spent
Friday continuing to stabilize Patrick Crawford, 7, who was burned
over 65 percent of his body and in critical condition after a
suspicious Christmas tree fire broke out in their Val Verde home on
Thursday. Firefighters were planning to visit the little boy
Friday. By Sherry Joe Crosby. (Will move in the ``a'' national and
``n'' California news file.)

   X X X
